API Reference

Core Modules

@file config.py @brief Centralized configuration manager for the teleoperation system @details Provides type-safe access to robot configurations with validation

and centralized management of all robot parameters.

class config.Configuration[source]

Bases: object

@brief Configuration manager for robotic arm teleoperation system @details Provides centralized access to robot configurations with

validation and default value handling for all teleoperation modules.

ROBOT_CONFIGS = {'panda': {'arm_joint_count': 7, 'axis_remap': {'pitch': 'pitch', 'roll': 'roll', 'vx': 'vx', 'vy': 'vy', 'vz': 'vz', 'yaw': 'yaw'}, 'end_effector_body': 'hand', 'movement_scales': {'deadzone_threshold': 0.1, 'gripper_close_pos': 0.0, 'gripper_open_pos': 1.0, 'gripper_speed': 1, 'rotation': 0.5, 'tilt': 0.5, 'translation': 0.3}, 'name': 'Franka Emika Panda', 'xml_path': 'franka_emika_panda/panda.xml'}, 'so100': {'arm_joint_count': 5, 'axis_remap': {'pitch': 'yaw', 'roll': 'pitch', 'vx': 'vy', 'vy': 'vz', 'vz': 'vx', 'yaw': 'roll'}, 'end_effector_body': 'Fixed_Jaw', 'joint_multipliers': {'elbow': 1.0, 'pitch': 1.0, 'rotation': 0.005, 'wrist_pitch': 0.02, 'wrist_roll': 0.01}, 'movement_scales': {'deadzone_threshold': 0.1, 'gripper_close_pos': 0.0, 'gripper_open_pos': 0.0123, 'gripper_speed': 1, 'rotation': 0.4, 'tilt': 0.4, 'translation': 0.15}, 'name': 'SO100 Robotic Arm', 'xml_path': 'trs_so_arm100/so_arm100.xml'}, 'ur5': {'arm_joint_count': 6, 'axis_remap': {'pitch': 'pitch', 'roll': 'roll', 'vx': 'vx', 'vy': 'vy', 'vz': 'vz', 'yaw': 'yaw'}, 'end_effector_body': 'robotiq_base', 'movement_scales': {'deadzone_threshold': 0.1, 'gripper_close_pos': 0.0, 'gripper_open_pos': 1.0, 'gripper_speed': 1, 'rotation': 0.3, 'tilt': 0.3, 'translation': 0.2}, 'name': 'UR5e with 2F-85 Gripper', 'xml_path': 'universal_robots_ur5e/ur5e_with_gripper.xml'}}
get_joint_multipliers()[source]

@brief Retrieve joint control multipliers for specified robot

@param robot_name: Name of the robot @return: Dictionary of joint multiplier parameters

@note Returns default values (1.0) if joint_multipliers not defined

get_movement_scales()[source]

@brief Retrieve movement scaling parameters for specified robot

@param robot_name: Name of the robot @return: Dictionary of movement scale parameters

@note Returns default values if movement_scales not defined for robot

get_robot_config()[source]

@brief Retrieve configuration dictionary for specified robot

@param robot_name: Name of the robot configuration to retrieve @return: Copy of the robot configuration dictionary

@throws ValueError: If robot_name is not found in ROBOT_CONFIGS

@note Returns a copy to prevent modification of original configuration

@file simulation.py @brief MuJoCo simulation wrapper for robotic arm teleoperation @details Provides simulation environment, object manipulation utilities,

and real-time viewer synchronization.

class simulation.Simulation(robot_name, show_viewer=True)[source]

Bases: object

@brief MuJoCo simulation class for robotic arm teleoperation @details Manages simulation state, provides object query utilities,

and handles real-time visualization.

__init__(robot_name, show_viewer=True)[source]

@brief Initialize the simulation with robot configuration

@param robot_name: Name of the robot to use (‘panda’, ‘ur5’, ‘so100’) @param show_viewer: Whether to display the MuJoCo visualizer

@throws ValueError: If robot_name is not in supported configurations

@note Loads robot-specific XML and initial state from configuration

get_object_state(body_name)[source]

@brief Get world-frame position and orientation of a body

@param body_name: Name of the body to query @return: Tuple of (position, quaternion) arrays

@throws KeyError: If body_name is not found in the model

@note Attempts to use free joint position if available for accuracy

step()[source]

@brief Advance simulation by one step with real-time synchronization

@note Maintains real-time synchronization when viewer is active

@file movement_helper.py @brief Movement helper for pose integration and gripper control @details Handles smooth movement calculations, pose integration,

and gripper control for teleoperation systems.

class movement_helper.MovementHelper(sim, robot_name, dt=0.002, max_linear_speed=0.1, max_angular_speed=0.5)[source]

Bases: object

@brief Handles pose integration and movement calculations @details Provides smooth end-effector pose integration from twist commands

and gripper control with acceleration limiting.

__init__(sim, robot_name, dt=0.002, max_linear_speed=0.1, max_angular_speed=0.5)[source]

@brief Initialize movement helper with stability settings

@param sim: Simulation instance for accessing model and data @param robot_name: Name of the robot for configuration @param dt: Time step for integration (seconds) @param max_linear_speed: Maximum linear speed (m/s) @param max_angular_speed: Maximum angular speed (rad/s)

get_target_pose()[source]

@brief Get current target pose

@return: Tuple of (target_position, target_orientation)

integrate_twist(twist_command)[source]

@brief Integrate twist command to update target pose

@param twist_command: 6D twist [vx, vy, vz, wx, wy, wz] in end-effector frame @return: Tuple of (new_position, new_orientation)

@note Applies speed limits and transforms velocities to world frame

move_gripper(gripper_pos, speed)[source]

@brief Set target gripper position and movement speed

@param gripper_pos: Target position (0.0=closed, 1.0=open) @param speed: Movement speed (0-1 scale)

@note Converts normalized position to actuator control range

set_initial_pose(pos, quat)[source]

@brief Set initial end-effector pose for integration

@param pos: Initial position as 3D vector [x, y, z] @param quat: Initial orientation as quaternion [w, x, y, z]

update_gripper()[source]

@brief Update gripper position towards target with speed control

@note Moves gripper incrementally towards target position each call

Teleoperation Modules

@file genericteleoperation.py @brief Main teleoperation module for Panda and UR5 robots @details Handles gamepad input processing, IK solving, and simulation control

for 6DOF robotic arms using inverse kinematics.

class genericteleoperation.GenericTeleoperation(robot_name='panda')[source]

Bases: object

@brief Teleoperation system for Panda and UR5 robotic arms @details Provides complete 6DOF control using inverse kinematics

with smooth filtering and gripper control.

__init__(robot_name='panda')[source]

@brief Initialize teleoperation system for specified robot

@param robot_name: Name of the robot (‘panda’ or ‘ur5’)

@note Default robot is ‘panda’ if not specified

cleanup()[source]

@brief Clean up resources and shutdown systems

@note Closes viewer and quits pygame gracefully

get_twist_from_gamepad()[source]

@brief Convert gamepad inputs to end-effector twist commands

@return: Tuple of (twist_command, start_button, a_button_state)

  • twist_command: 6D twist vector [vx, vy, vz, roll, pitch, yaw]

  • start_button: Boolean indicating START button state

  • a_button_state: Boolean indicating A button state

@note Applies deadzone filtering and axis scaling from configuration

initialize_systems()[source]

@brief Initialize all required systems for teleoperation

@return: True if all systems initialized successfully, False otherwise

@throws RuntimeError: If no gamepad detected

@note Initializes pygame, gamepad, simulation, and control systems

process_gripper(a_button)[source]

@brief Process gripper control input with toggle behavior

@param a_button: Current state of A button

@note Toggles gripper state on button press with configurable positions

process_movement(twist_command)[source]

@brief Process movement command using inverse kinematics

@param twist_command: 6D twist command for end-effector movement

@note Applies low-pass filtering for smooth movement and handles IK convergence

remap_twist(twist)[source]

@brief Apply robot-specific axis remapping to twist command

@param twist: Original twist command [vx, vy, vz, roll, pitch, yaw] @return: Remapped twist command based on robot configuration

run()[source]

@brief Main teleoperation loop

@note Handles gamepad input, movement processing, and simulation stepping

Exits gracefully on START button or KeyboardInterrupt

genericteleoperation.main()[source]

@brief Main function for direct execution of generic teleoperation

@note Can be used for testing without the launcher system

@file so100teleoperation.py @brief SO100-specific teleoperation with hybrid control scheme

class so100teleoperation.SO100JointController(sim)[source]

Bases: object

@brief Joint-space controller for SO100-specific movements @details Provides direct joint control for rotation, wrist_pitch, and wrist_roll

with scaling and multiplier application from configuration.

__init__(sim)[source]

@brief Initialize SO100 joint controller

@param sim: Simulation instance for accessing model and data

@note Builds joint mapping and loads configuration parameters

control_rotation_joint(left_stick_x)[source]

@brief Control base rotation joint

@param left_stick_x: Left stick horizontal input value

@note Applies movement scale and joint multiplier from configuration

control_wrist_pitch(l1, r1)[source]

@brief Control wrist pitch using shoulder buttons

@param l1: Left shoulder button state (0 or 1) @param r1: Right shoulder button state (0 or 1)

@note Differential control: l1 decreases, r1 increases pitch

control_wrist_roll(l2, r2)[source]

@brief Control wrist roll using triggers

@param l2: Left trigger value (0.0 to 1.0) @param r2: Right trigger value (0.0 to 1.0)

@note Differential control: l2 decreases, r2 increases roll

class so100teleoperation.SO100Teleoperation[source]

Bases: object

@brief SO100-specific teleoperation system with hybrid control @details Implements hybrid control scheme using joint control for rotations

and inverse kinematics for translations with conflict prevention.

__init__()[source]

@brief Initialize SO100 teleoperation system

@note Loads SO100-specific configuration and control parameters

calculate_pure_translation(current_pos, right_y, left_y, translation_scale, dt)[source]

@brief Calculate target position using rotation joint as reference

@param current_pos: Current end-effector position @param right_y: Right stick Y input (horizontal movement) @param left_y: Left stick Y input (vertical movement) @param translation_scale: Movement scaling factor @param dt: Time step for integration

@return: Target position as 3D vector

@note Uses rotation joint position as reference for radial movement

cleanup()[source]

@brief Clean up resources and shutdown systems

@note Closes viewer and quits pygame gracefully

get_input_from_gamepad()[source]

@brief Get modified input structure for SO100 pure translational control

@return: Dictionary containing all gamepad input values

@note Applies deadzone filtering and returns structured input data

get_rotation_joint_position()[source]

@brief Get world position of rotation joint for movement reference

@return: Position of rotation joint as 3D vector

@note Attempts multiple methods to find rotation joint position

initialize_systems()[source]

@brief Initialize all required systems for SO100 teleoperation

@return: True if all systems initialized successfully, False otherwise

@throws RuntimeError: If no gamepad detected

@note Sets up pygame, simulation, joint controller, and IK systems

process_gripper(a_button)[source]

@brief Process gripper control input with toggle behavior

@param a_button: Current state of A button

@note Toggles gripper state on button press with configurable positions

process_joint_control(input_data)[source]

@brief Process joint-space control for manual joints

@param input_data: Dictionary containing gamepad input values

@note Controls rotation, wrist_roll, and wrist_pitch joints directly

process_translation_control(input_data)[source]

@brief Process translational control using IK with conflict prevention

@param input_data: Dictionary containing gamepad input values

@note Skips translation when significant rotation input is detected

to prevent control conflicts between manual and IK control

run()[source]

@brief Main teleoperation loop for SO100

@note Handles input processing, control execution, and simulation stepping

with comprehensive user feedback and error handling

so100teleoperation.main()[source]

@brief Legacy main function for direct execution without launcher

@note Can be used for testing SO100 teleoperation independently

IK Solvers

@file generic_ik_solver.py @brief Generic velocity-based inverse kinematics solver @details Uses damped least squares method for stable joint-space trajectories

with joint limit enforcement and singularity handling.

class generic_ik_solver.GenericVelocityIKSolver(model, data, end_effector_body, arm_joint_count=None)[source]

Bases: object

@brief Inverse kinematics solver using Jacobian pseudo-inverse method @details Implements iterative damped least squares for end-effector pose control

with numerical stability and joint limit constraints.

__init__(model, data, end_effector_body, arm_joint_count=None)[source]

@brief Initialize IK solver for specified end effector

@param model: MuJoCo model object containing robot kinematics @param data: MuJoCo data object for current simulation state @param end_effector_body: Name of end effector body for IK targeting @param arm_joint_count: Number of arm joints to use for IK solution

@throws ValueError: If end_effector_body not found in model

@note Automatically detects revolute joints for IK control

solve(target_pos, target_quat, max_iterations=50, tolerance=0.001)[source]

@brief Solve inverse kinematics for target end-effector pose

@param target_pos: Target position as 3D vector [x, y, z] @param target_quat: Target orientation as quaternion [w, x, y, z] @param max_iterations: Maximum number of gradient descent iterations @param tolerance: Convergence tolerance for pose error norm

@return: Tuple of (joint_positions, success_flag)

  • joint_positions: Array of solved joint angles

  • success_flag: Boolean indicating convergence success

@throws LinAlgError: If Jacobian matrix is singular during inversion

@note Uses damped least squares: $Delta q = J^T (JJ^T + lambda I)^{-1} e$

where $e$ is the 6D pose error vector and $lambda$ is damping factor

@file so100_ik_solver.py @brief Specialized IK solver for SO100 5DOF arm with joint preservation @details Preserves manually controlled joints while solving for position

using a hybrid inverse kinematics approach.

class so100_ik_solver.SO100IKSolver(model, data, end_effector_body, joint_controller)[source]

Bases: object

@brief 5DOF IK solver that preserves manually controlled joints @details Implements position-only inverse kinematics while fixing

rotation, wrist_pitch, and wrist_roll joints to prevent conflicts between manual control and IK solutions.

__init__(model, data, end_effector_body, joint_controller)[source]

@brief Initialize IK solver for SO100 arm

@param model: MuJoCo model object containing robot kinematics @param data: MuJoCo data object for current simulation state @param end_effector_body: Name of end effector body for IK targeting @param joint_controller: SO100Teleoperation instance for joint mapping

@throws ValueError: If end_effector_body not found in model

@note Builds joint mapping and defines control strategy automatically

solve_position_only(target_pos, fixed_rotation=None, fixed_wrist_roll=None, fixed_wrist_pitch=None, max_iterations=50, tolerance=0.001)[source]

@brief Solve IK for position only while preserving manual joints

@param target_pos: Target position as 3D vector [x, y, z] @param fixed_rotation: Fixed value for rotation joint (optional) @param fixed_wrist_roll: Fixed value for wrist roll joint (optional) @param fixed_wrist_pitch: Fixed value for wrist pitch joint (optional) @param max_iterations: Maximum number of iterations @param tolerance: Convergence tolerance for position error

@return: Tuple of (position_joint_values, success_flag)

  • position_joint_values: Dictionary mapping joint names to values

  • success_flag: Boolean indicating convergence success

@note Only solves for pitch and elbow joints while fixing other joints

to maintain manual control integrity

Launcher

@file gamepad_control.py @brief Main launcher for robotic arm teleoperation system @details Provides unified entry point with robot selection interface

and system initialization for all supported robots.

class gamepad_control.GamepadControlLauncher[source]

Bases: object

@brief Main launcher class for robotic arm teleoperation systems @details Handles robot selection, system initialization, and provides

command-line and interactive selection interfaces.

__init__()[source]

@brief Initialize the gamepad control launcher with available robots

get_robot_info(robot_name)[source]

@brief Retrieve basic information about a specific robot

@param robot_name: Name of the robot to query @return: Dictionary with robot info or None if robot not found

@note Returns None if robot configuration cannot be retrieved

initialize_teleop_system()[source]

@brief Initialize appropriate teleoperation system based on selected robot

@return: True if initialization successful, False otherwise

@throws ImportError: If required teleoperation module cannot be imported @throws Exception: For general initialization failures

@note Uses SO100-specific system for SO100, generic for Panda/UR5

run()[source]

@brief Execute the selected teleoperation system

@note Handles KeyboardInterrupt and general exceptions gracefully

select_robot(robot_name)[source]

@brief Select and validate robot for teleoperation

@param robot_name: Name of the robot to control @return: True if selection valid and robot available, False otherwise

@note Prints error message and available options if robot not found

gamepad_control.main()[source]

@brief Main entry point for gamepad control application

@details Supports both command-line arguments and interactive selection

Displays available robots and usage instructions
